analytic.title: The Emperor Maurice through East Syriac Eyes

imprint.publisher: Association des Amis du Centre d’Histoire et Civilisation de Byzance

biblStruct.note: A Syriac Narrative concerning the death of the emperor Maurice was published in 1910 by François Nau. Of East Syriac provenance, this shares certain features with the legends surrounding Maurice’s death that are first found in Theophylact Simocatta and Ps.-John of Antioch. After a brief introduction, the Syriac Narrative is provided with a translation, followed by discussion of its relationship to other sources and of its probable dating. An appendix gives a translation of the section on Maurice to be found in the Syriac Life of Sabrishoʿ, catholicos of the Church of the East (596–604).

body.bibl: Brock, Sebastian P. “The Emperor Maurice through East Syriac Eyes.” In Mélanges James Howard-Johnston, edited by Philip Booth and Mary Whitby, 259–69. Travaux et Mémoires 26. Paris: Association des Amis du Centre d’Histoire et Civilisation de Byzance, 2022.

Sebastian P. Brock, The Emperor Maurice through East Syriac Eyes, in Mélanges James Howard-Johnston, ed. Philip Booth and Mary Whitby, Travaux et Mémoires 26 (Paris: Association des Amis du Centre d’Histoire et Civilisation de Byzance, 2022), 259–69.
